definition: bit by bit/every little bit
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
a drop/to drip

sentences.english: The collective wealth has been accumulated bit by bit.
sentences.chinese: 集體的家業是一點一滴地積攢起來的。

sentences.english: A child assimilates it only gradually .
sentences.chinese: 兒童只能一點一滴地掌握它。

sentences.english: One day it will anew exhumed bit minted into good.
sentences.chinese: 總有一天會從新挖掘出來一點一滴鑄造成美好。

sentences.english: Progress of a student should be largely attributed to his teachers' direction and enlightenment.
sentences.chinese: 孩子一點一滴的進步主要來自於老師們的指導和點撥。

sentences.english: Taxes were collected in dribs and drabs.
sentences.chinese: 稅是一點一滴收集起來的。

sentences.english: In dribs and drabs , parts of the appliance came together.
sentences.chinese: 一點一滴地，這個裝置的幾個部分終於成形了。

sentences.english: My knowledge all came in drips and drabs after I got there.
sentences.chinese: 一切都是來港後一點一滴逐漸認識的。

sentences.english: Sometimes it’s nice to enjoy each morsel of life as it comes.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，慢慢的享受生活的一點一滴是很幸福的。

sentences.english: The time is sneaking off, Bit by bit, does not have the sound.
sentences.chinese: 時間在溜走，一點一滴，沒有聲息。

sentences.english: Big success comes from small, consistent changes.
sentences.chinese: 積土成山，成功來自於一點一滴，堅持就會改變。

definition: bit by bit/dribs and drabs/the little details/every aspect
little by little/bit by bit/gradually
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
accustomed to/used to
endless/boundless/infinite
a drip/a little bit/intravenous drip (used to administer drugs)
scattered and smashed (idiom)
to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
gradually
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
four types of human emotions, namely: happiness 歡喜|欢喜[huan1 xi3], anger 憤怒|愤怒[fen4 nu4], sorrow 悲哀[bei1 ai1] and joy 快樂|快乐[kuai4 le4]
to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to rack one's brains
in the end/after all is said and done
not to mind taking all the trouble (idiom)/to take great pains/to be very patient
to bother/to disturb/to vex
